advantage.name: Absolute direction
advantage.description: This gives a bonus to survival, area lore and survival rolls to find the way, or to remember places and routes.

advantage.name: Broad shoulders
advantage.description: The character is good at carrying heavy loads, and is considered to have a bonus to strength for purposes of encumbrance and the wearing of armour (though does not apply to the minimum strength requirement to wield a weapon).

advantage.name: Keen hearing
advantage.description: The character has very good hearing, and gains a bonus to hearing based perception rolls.

advantage.name: Animal affinity
advantage.description: Gives a bonus to skills when trying to befriend animals, such as hunting, falconry or ostling.

advantage.name: Beautiful
advantage.description: The character is very good looking, and gets a bonus to charisma when trying to charm members of a compatible sex. There are two levels to this advantage, the second level giving +2 to Charisma instead of +1.

advantage.name: Beautiful voice
advantage.description: The character has a very clear and pleasant voice, getting a bonus to charisma when singing, orating or reading poetry.

advantage.name: Combat reflexes
advantage.description: The character has very fast reflexes, which give a bonus to all initiative rolls, as well as rolls to surprise, and to avoid being surprised.

advantage.name: Empathy
advantage.description: The character is good at reading people's emotions, and gets a bonus to perception when making guile rolls.

advantage.name: Hardy convalescence
advantage.description: Gives a bonus to stamina whenever recovering from wounds or when first aid is performed on an injury.

advantage.name: Heavy drinker
advantage.description: Gives a bonus to stamina rolls when drinking alcohol or other intoxicants, in order to resist falling over or becoming comatose.

advantage.name: Keen vision
advantage.description: Gain a bonus to vision rolls to see things at a distance.

advantage.name: Light sleeper
advantage.description: Gain a bonus to awareness rolls when asleep. When sleeping, such rolls are normally halved.

advantage.name: Musical ability
advantage.description: The character has a natural talent with music, and gains a bonus when playing musical instruments (but not singing).

advantage.name: Need little sleep
advantage.description: The character can go for longer without sleep than most people. Their stamina is effectively at +1 for purposes of sleep deprivation.

advantage.name: Night vision
advantage.description: Gain a bonus to vision rolls in darkness.

advantage.name: Remember's faces
advantage.description: The character has a good memory for faces, and gets a bonus to intelligence when trying to recognise a person by looks or the sound of their voice.

advantage.name: Resistant to disease
advantage.description: Gain a bonus to all rolls to resist disease.

advantage.name: Resistant to poison
advantage.description: Gain a bonus to all rolls to resist poison.

advantage.name: Situational awareness
advantage.description: You have a keen sense of where you are, and probably more importantly, where everyone else is. Gain a bonus to awareness rolls in combat situations.

advantage.name: Sure footed
advantage.description: The character has a good sense of balance, and gets a bonus to athletic rolls when balancing on narrow ledges, breaking their fall and climbing.

advantage.name: Absent minded
advantage.description: The character has a poor memory, and suffers a penalty to intelligence when trying to remember something. This applies to most knowledge based checks.

advantage.name: Animal enmity
advantage.description: Animals hate the character. Cats will scratch and dogs will bite if the character gets too close. This also makes riding difficult - the penalty affects with all rolls to befriend, control or ride animals.

advantage.name: Big mouth
advantage.description: The character suffers a penalty to social interaction rolls when subtlety is required.

advantage.name: Can't sing
advantage.description: The character suffers a penalty to all attempts at singing, dancing, poetry and story telling.

advantage.name: Gullible
advantage.description: This gives a penalty to the character's guile skill to perceive lies and other deceptions.

advantage.name: Heavy sleeper
advantage.description: This gives a penalty to all rolls to wake up.

advantage.name: Inept student
advantage.description: When studying either with a book, or under a teacher, a penalty is suffered to intelligence.

advantage.name: Invalid
advantage.description: Gain a penalty to healing rolls to recover from wounds, and to first aid attempts made on the character.

advantage.name: Lame
advantage.description: The character has a penalty to athletics rolls, and to initiative in melee combat.

advantage.name: Light drinker
advantage.description: A penalty to stamina rolls to resist the effects of drunkenness.

advantage.name: Non-combatant
advantage.description: The character suffers a penalty to all combat skills if using them 'for real' (as opposed to say an archery contest).

advantage.name: Poor sense of direction
advantage.description: The character suffers a penalty to area lore, survival and navigation skills when trying to navigate.

advantage.name: Obese
advantage.description: The character is greatly overweight, and suffers a penalty to athletics, brawl and stealth rolls, as well as stamina for purposes of fatigue (including the number of fatigue levels the character has).

advantage.name: Poor sense of balance
advantage.description: The character suffers a penalty to rolls to remain standing, to walk across a log and other such tasks.

advantage.name: Poor vision
advantage.description: The character has very poor eyesight, and suffers a penalty to all vision based perception rolls (including missile attacks).

advantage.name: Poor hearing
advantage.description: The character has very poor hearing, and suffers a penalty to all hearing based perception rolls.

advantage.name: Repellent
advantage.description: The character is for some reason repellent to members of the opposite sex. Any attempts to befriend, seduce or otherwise charm a member of the opposite sex is at penalty.

advantage.name: Ugly
advantage.description: The character is not attractive to look at. Normally, it will not have much effect, though if he is trying to impress a member of the opposite sex, or trying to convince others that he is a good guy (everybody knows good guys are attractive and have good hair), then a penalty applies to his charisma.

advantage.name: Short attention span
advantage.description: The character is easily bored, and suffers a penalty to perception when on guard duty, or performing other long term, boring actions, such as steering a boat.

advantage.name: Shy
advantage.description: The character suffers a penalty to social skills around strangers, and possibly to other skills if people are watching.

advantage.name: Terrible liar
advantage.description: The character suffers a penalty to guile when trying to deceive people.

advantage.name: Uninspiring
advantage.description: The character has an uninspiring personality, to the point of being utterly forgettable. They suffer a penalty when trying to impress people.

advantage.name: Weak health
advantage.description: The character's immune system is not able to cope well with poison or disease, and the character suffers a penalty when trying to resist such.
